    Enabling PS Store

    If you like the guide, please consider donating via PayPal.

    If you have any issues or problems, read the FAQ or ask on our Discord Server.

    On July 29th, Sony disabled activation on HENkaku-enabled devices. This means that if you didn’t activate your device before then, you can’t use the PS Store.

    ReNpDrm and ReStore are plugins by CelesteBlue that allow you to activate your Vita and use the PS Store.

    Bans are theoretically possible, however none have been reported. Use this software at your own risk. CelesteBlue or I will not take responsibility for anything that happens to your device.

    Downloads

    • An FTP Client
      • For Windows, I’d recommend FileZilla or WinSCP
    • The latest release of ReNpDrm
    • The latest release of ReStore

    Instructions

    Make sure your Vita and computer are connected to the same internet

    1. Open MolecularShell on your Vita
    2. Press Select
    3. Open your FTP client on your computer
    4. Type in the IP Address and Port shown on your Vita
    5. Navigate to ux0:data on the FTP Client
    6. Transfer the ReNpDrm .skprx file
    7. Transfer the ResTORE .suprx file
    8. Press O on your Vita to close the server
    9. Navigate to ux0:data on your Vita
    10. Press Triangle and copy the file
    11. Navigate to ur0:tai and paste it there
    12. Open config.txt
    13. Go to *KERNEL and press Triangle > Insert empty line
    14. Type into the new line: ur0:tai/renpdrm.skprx
    15. Go to *main and press Triangle > Insert empty line
    16. Type into the new line: ur0:tai/restore.suprx
    17. Exit and save changes
    18. Delete the directory ux0:tai if it exists
      • If you have any other plugins previously installed, copy those over to ur0:tai and edit ur0:tai/config.txt accordingly
    19. Reboot your console
